topics.title: Really, python?
topics.body: ZeroNet is a really interesting, well managed and badly needed project, but there is one thing that really puts it off for me: Python. Why is it written in this bloated, huge and slow, high-level scripting language? Is it basically because that's what people know, and is "easiest", or are there some reason I can't comprehend? I'd imagine this kind of project would be perfect with a efficient C backbone, and then with the GUI written in Javascript on top. Or is it something I'm not seeing in the big picture here?

1@247.body:
We totally should push for this, and also make zeronet much more approachable for the masses. 
But I don't think much of their code are usable, I think it's more productive if you post the exact features you feel that ZeroTalk are lacking.
